intro: Goniophlebium hirsutulum, commonly known as the hairy-leafed fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves that are typically arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its fronds are usually elongated and can reach lengths of up to 30 centimeters. Goniophlebium hirsutulum plays a role in maintaining soil stability and providing habitat for small organisms in its native ecosystems.
